recipe_name: Slow cooked Brussels sprouts and leek stew with soft-boiled eggs
author: Phil Vickery
method: Heat the oil in a frying pan over a medium heat and add the Brussels sprouts, sweet potato and leeks and fry for five minutes. Add the lime juice and vegetable stock. Place the cornflour into a bowl and add a little water to make a smooth paste. Add the cornflour paste and the tomato purée to the pan and cook for three minutes. To serve, transfer the stew into a serving bowl and serve with the herbs and boiled eggs on top.
ingredients: 1 tbsp olive oil,  100g/ 3½oz Brussels sprouts, chopped,  75g/ 2½oz sweet potato,  2 baby leeks, chopped,  ½ lime, juice only,  100ml/ 3½fl oz hot vegetable stock,  1 tsp cornflour,  1 tbsp tomato purée,  handful fresh flatleaf parsley,  handful fresh coriander, chopped,  2 free-range eggs, soft-boiled, peeled
